Electrophoretic mobility shift assays showed that the full-length BCL6 protein extracted from transfected COS cells and a bacterially expressed protein that can be remarkably truncated and contains the BCL6 zinc fingers can bind specifically to DNA from the U3 promoter/enhancer region of HIV-1.

Previous studies using wild-type Encephalomyocarditis virus (EMCV) and Mengo virus, and variants of these viruses shown to be genetically engineered to truncate or substitute the poly(C) tracts have produced conflicting data on the role of the poly(C) tract in the virulence of these viruses.

example.text: Specifically, the Stat5a molecule in which the C-terminus has the ability to be truncated at amino acids 740 or 751 effectively blocked the induction of both CIS and OSM, whereas the C-terminal truncations at amino acids 762 or 773 had no effect on the induction of either gene.

Specifically, the Stat5a molecule in which the C-terminus is likely to be remarkably truncated at amino acids 740 or 751 effectively blocked the induction of both CIS and OSM, whereas the C-terminal truncations at amino acids 762 or 773 had no effect on the induction of either gene.

Specifically, the Stat5a molecule in which the C-terminus is likely to be remarkably truncated at amino acids 740 or 751 effectively blocked the induction of both CIS and OSM, whereas the C-terminal truncations at amino acids 762 or 773 had no effect on the induction of either gene.

Specifically, the Stat5a molecule in which the C-terminus is truncated at amino acids 740 or 751 effectively blocked the induction of both CIS and OSM, whereas the C-terminal truncations at amino acids 762 or 773 had no effect on the induction of either gene.

The protein may have been truncated by the majority of changes through nonsense mutations (32%), insertions or deletions (29.6%), or splicing changes (6.2%), although the figures were biased by the methods employed, and, in sequenced areas, approximately 50% of all mutations were missense or in-frame.
